call_title: Trustless Bitcoin Relay on Ergo | Alex Chepurnoy | ErgoHack VIII

topics.title: Bitcoin Relay Introduction and Core Concept
topics.summary: Introduction to trustless Bitcoin relay as a minimal Bitcoin client implemented as an Ergo contract. The system validates proof of work, stores Bitcoin block headers, builds the best chain, and can validate Bitcoin transaction inclusion similar to SPV clients.

topics.title: Bitcoin Relay Use Cases and Applications
topics.summary: Overview of potential applications including Bitcoin hashrate derivatives for miners, making Ergo a smart contract layer for Bitcoin, and enabling trustless bridging. Discussion of cross-chain exchange possibilities and limitations in reverse bridging from Ergo to Bitcoin.

topics.title: Bitcoin Relay History on Other Blockchains
topics.summary: Brief history of Bitcoin relays on other platforms, noting Ethereum's expensive and often lagging relay supported by ConsenSys, and Nervos blockchain's recent implementation for RGB++ protocol.

topics.title: ErgoHack Submission Scope and Contract Architecture
topics.summary: Detailed technical explanation of the two-contract system: relay contract that validates headers and manages blockchain state, and inclusion validation contract that proves Bitcoin transaction inclusion. Description of data structures including best headers tree, all headers tree, and efficient fork switching mechanisms.

topics.title: Contract Efficiency and Testing Results
topics.summary: Performance analysis showing efficient fork resolution and block addition operations requiring only kilobytes of data transfer. Confirmation that both contracts have been tested and are working in simulated blockchain environment.

topics.title: Future Development and Research Directions
topics.summary: Outline of missing components including transaction parser development, economic incentive models for block submission, and potential applications like RGB++ implementation. Invitation for community development with code released in public domain for both commercial and non-commercial use.
